sense.name: sieze, stop the movement of something, entangle
sense.examples: Catch the ball! He quickly caught the elevator door and pushed it open. We have a big barrel to catch the rainwater. Who is catching for the Angels today? One foot caught in the stirrup. His look caught her. She caught his eye. I was caught in traffic and missed the meeting. The billboard caught my attention. She caught him before he could say anything else. She managed to catch herself before telling her boss what was really on her mind.

sense.name: capture, ensnare, discover in the act
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CATCH NP2 Includes: CAUGHT OUT
sense.examples: She caught her son eating candy. He was caught shoplifting. The reporter caught the senator in his lie. He caught her staring out the window. Cheating students were caught out by cellphone monitors. I caught a rabbit in a trap today. Did you finally catch the thief? She caught his heart. She really caught the spirit of the place in her drawings.

sense.name: perceive, understand, be aware of
sense.commentary: Includes: CATCH ON, CATCH A GLIMPSE
sense.examples: I caught the aroma of coffee. He caught the allusion of her glance. He caught a glimpse of her by the last rays of twilight. We caught the conversation at the next table. We caught something of his theory in the lecture. A mammogram may not catch a small tumor. I don't catch your meaning. I didn't catch your name. She didn't get the joke at first, but then she caught on.

sense.name: connect with; reach a target or goal
sense.examples: I have to catch a train at 7:00. The Rolls Royce caught us near the exit ramp. I caught up on my homework. I'm trying to catch up with the latest developments. We spent hours catching up on the phone. I'll catch you later!

sense.name: receive, be affected by, suffer
sense.commentary: Includes: CATCH COLD, CATCH FIRE, CATCH IT
sense.examples: Even little Edris caught the mood and began to giggle. The tablecloth caught fire. Did you catch a cold? She will catch hell for this behavior! I really caught it the next day, for stealing my mom's things. I was caught up in the excitement.

sense.name: attend an entertainment or event
sense.examples: Let's catch a movie. There's still time to catch the best show on television. After work, they caught a baseball game.

sense.name: start and spread
sense.examples: The fire caught. The fashion did not catch. The building green trend is catching in the corporate world. This diet plan never really caught on.

sense.name: get something necessary
sense.commentary: Note: usually abstract Includes: CATCH A WINK, CATCH ONE'S BREATH, CATCH SOME Z'S
sense.examples: Let's catch a bite to eat. I need to catch a few zzzzs. Give him a moment to catch his breath. I haven't caught a wink in the past few nights.

sense.name: hit, contact
sense.examples: The rock caught her in the back of the head. The punch caught him in the stomach.
